sentence.Network_en: I need help because my wife has lost her locket.
sentence.Network_cn: 我需要您的帮忙,我太太把项链坠丢了.

sentence.Network_en: FULL view is a heart shaped locket on a chain hanging down.
sentence.Network_cn: 众目睽睽是一个心形锁链上悬挂下来.

sentence.Network_en: It a gold locket on the inside an inscription. Destiny.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是个金的项链坠,里面刻了字: 命运.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Old French locquet, diminutive of loc 'latch, lock', of Germanic origin; related to lock. Sense 1 dates from the late 17th cent

entry.tran: （项链上装照片等的）盒式吊坠
entry.def: A locket is a piece of jewellery containing something such as a picture, which a woman wears on a chain around her neck.

means.word_mean: 1. a small ornamental case; usually contains a picture or a lock of hair and is worn on a necklace

auth_sentence.content: A trinket that she wore on a chain round her neck...a gold locket.
auth_sentence.res_content: A trinket that she wore on a chain round her neck...a gold locket.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A trinket that she wore on a chain round her neck...a gold locket.

auth_sentence.content: A locket containing ringlets which he avouches, in confidence, to be relics of a Spanish girl.
auth_sentence.res_content: A locket containing ringlets which he avouches, in confidence, to be relics of a Spanish girl.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A locket containing ringlets which he avouches, in confidence, to be relics of a Spanish girl.

auth_sentence.content: Lucy Locket lost her pocket, Kitty Fisher found it; Not a penny was there in it, Only ribbon round it.
